Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Hierarchical porous network; extended nanopore network

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Allowed by size-exclusion, captured by specific aptamer affinity and adsorption sites

Other Information.Test Conditions: Optimized conditions: 0.1 % TFA aqueous solution, 25 min incubation, 10 µg Mag MOF@COF-Apt for 1 µg E2, room temperature
Other Information.Additional Info: Target molecule for SERS detection, selectively enriched from complex samples.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion, effectively prevented by the porous structure

Other Information.Additional Info: Interferents effectively prevented by the porous structure, enhancing selectivity for E2.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion, effectively prevented by the porous structure

Other Information.Additional Info: Salt interferent effectively prevented by the porous structure, enhancing selectivity for E2.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving via size exclusion in hierarchical porous network

Experimental Validation.Method: SERS analysis, Powder X-ray diffraction, FTIR, UV–Vis absorption spectroscopy, N2 adsorption–desorption isotherm
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: E2 detection limit: 110.14 nmol L−1; Linear range: 0.18–11.01 µmol L−1 (R2 = 0.9908); Reproducibility (RSD): 7.29 %; Reusability: over four cycles; Tolerance to protein (40 mg mL−1 BSA, HSA) and salt (40 mg mL−1 NaCl) interference; Serum sample recovery: 98.94–107.58 %

Other Information.Additional Info: Magnetic hierarchical porous material designed for selective recognition and SERS analysis of E2. Composed of a magnetic Fe-MOF core (MIL-101(Fe)-NH2) with an in situ grown TAPB-DMTP-COF layer, functionalized with E2 aptamer. Provides SERS enhancement via on-shell-isolated effect. High surface area (1385.821 m2 g−1). Magnetic properties enable easy separation.
